rules.natural: If a sensor technology is deployed on an animal, then that technology is actively tracking that animal.
Either a sensor technology is deployed on an animal, or a drone technology is used on that animal.
Whenever a drone technology is used on an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal.
When a platform receives grant funding for a project, data for that project is processed using a skill.
Under the condition that a platform receives grant funding for a project, a report for that project is generated using a skill.
A platform either receives grant funding for a project or is crowdfunded for that project.
If a platform is crowdfunded for a project, then, if a technology is actively tracking an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal.
If a project purchases equipment in the form of a technology, then, provided that a technology is actively tracking an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal.
If a platform is a government agency, then, if that platform receives grant funding for a project, the project purchases equipment in the form of a technology.
Either a platform is a government agency, or it is a university lab.
When a platform is a university lab, then, if that platform receives grant funding for a project, the project purchases equipment in the form of a technology.
If a publication is in an open format, then it is not in a proprietary format.
If the data in a publication is curated, then, given that the publication has complete metadata, it is not in an incompatible format.
Whenever the analysis in a publication is flawed, the conclusion of that publication is valid.
Under the condition that the analysis in a publication is flawed, the methodology of that publication is sound.
If the analysis in a publication is flawed, then the conclusion of that publication is not valid.
If a researcher consults a statistician about a skill, then that researcher reviews a method concerning a skill.

If a researcher reviews a method concerning a skill, then, given that a platform develops a technology, then, if it is not true that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal.

If a platform publishes a study in a publication, then, should it not be the case that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal.
A platform either publishes a study in a publication or develops a technology.
If a researcher replicates a study from a publication, then a hypothesis in that publication is supported.
Either a researcher replicates a study from a publication, or that researcher fails to replicate a study from that publication.

If a researcher’s controls for a publication are adequate, then, should that researcher fail to replicate a study from that publication, it is not the case that a hypothesis in that publication is rejected.
A researcher’s controls for a publication are either adequate or inadequate.

Under the condition that a researcher’s controls for a publication are inadequate, then, if that researcher fails to replicate a study from that publication, it is not the case that a hypothesis in that publication is rejected.
If a publication receives peer feedback on a skill, then the data in that publication is verified.
Provided that a publication receives editor feedback on a skill, that publication does not have missing data.
If a publication undergoes major revisions for a skill, then that publication receives peer feedback on a skill.
A publication either undergoes major revisions for a skill or undergoes minor revisions for a skill.
Whenever a publication undergoes minor revisions for a skill, that publication receives editor feedback on a skill.
If a project hires an analyst for a skill, then, given that a technology is actively tracking an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal.
Provided that an analyst for a project is trained in a skill, that project hires an analyst for that skill.
If data for a project is processed using a skill, then an analyst for that project is trained in that skill.
If a project’s deadline is extended, then that project misses a milestone.
Provided that a researcher masters a skill, that researcher consults a statistician about a skill.
If a researcher masters a skill, then that researcher is trained in a skill.

If a researcher is trained in a skill, then, given that a platform develops a technology, then, if it is not the case that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal.
Whenever a publication is open access, there is a conservation impact on an animal.
If a publication is peer reviewed, then there is a conservation impact on an animal.
If it is not the case that either the data in a publication is verified or it is not the case that the publication has missing data, then the publication is retracted.
Provided that it is not true that either the data in a publication is verified or it is not the case that the publication has missing data, the publication is not retracted.
If it is not the case that, if the analysis in a publication is flawed, then the methodology of that publication is not sound, then the ethics of that publication are approved.
Under the condition that it is not true that, if the analysis in a publication is flawed, then the methodology of that publication is not sound, the ethics of that publication are not approved.

Provided that it is not true that, if a report for a project is generated using a skill, then, given that a technology is actively tracking an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal, the project’s deadline is extended.
If it is not the case that a publication is either open access or peer reviewed, then that publication has missing data.

If it is not the case that, if it is not true that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal, then a hypothesis in a publication is rejected.
Provided that it is not the case that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then a publication is in an open format, that publication is in an incompatible format.
If the data in a publication is not curated, then the analysis in that publication is flawed.
If there is no conservation impact on an animal, then a platform uses a research database for a researcher.
Provided that there is no conservation impact on an animal, a publication is in a proprietary format.

(A5 → A6).natural: If a researcher masters a skill, then that researcher is trained in a skill.

(A6 → (A4 → (¬(¬G → ¬A1) → A2))).natural: If a researcher is trained in a skill, then, given that a platform develops a technology, then, if it is not the case that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal.

(A7 → G).natural: Whenever a publication is open access, there is a conservation impact on an animal.

(A7 ∨ A8).natural: A publication is either open access or peer reviewed.

(A8 → G).natural: If a publication is peer reviewed, then there is a conservation impact on an animal.

(¬(A10 ∨ ¬A9) → A11).natural: If it is not the case that either the data in a publication is verified or it is not the case that the publication has missing data, then the publication is retracted.

(¬(A10 ∨ ¬A9) → ¬A11).natural: Provided that it is not true that either the data in a publication is verified or it is not the case that the publication has missing data, the publication is not retracted.

(¬(A25 → ¬A45) → A46).natural: If it is not the case that, if the analysis in a publication is flawed, then the methodology of that publication is not sound, then the ethics of that publication are approved.

(¬(A25 → ¬A45) → ¬A46).natural: Under the condition that it is not true that, if the analysis in a publication is flawed, then the methodology of that publication is not sound, the ethics of that publication are not approved.

(¬(A42 → (A14 → G)) → A43).natural: If it is not the case that, if a report for a project is generated using a skill, then, should a technology be actively tracking an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal, then the project misses a milestone.

(¬(A42 → (A14 → G)) → A44).natural: Provided that it is not true that, if a report for a project is generated using a skill, then, given that a technology is actively tracking an animal, there is a conservation impact on that animal, the project’s deadline is extended.

(¬(A7 ∨ A8) → A9).natural: If it is not the case that a publication is either open access or peer reviewed, then that publication has missing data.

(¬(¬(¬G → ¬A1) → A2) → A29).natural: If it is not the case that, if it is not true that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal, then a hypothesis in a publication is rejected.

(¬(¬G → A21) → A22).natural: Provided that it is not the case that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then a publication is in an open format, that publication is in an incompatible format.

(¬(¬G → ¬A1) → A2).natural: If it is not the case that, if there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher, a technology collects field data on an animal.

(¬A24 → A25).natural: If the data in a publication is not curated, then the analysis in that publication is flawed.

(¬G → A1).natural: If there is no conservation impact on an animal, then a platform uses a research database for a researcher.

(¬G → A20).natural: Provided that there is no conservation impact on an animal, a publication is in a proprietary format.

(¬G → A21).natural: Under the condition that there is no conservation impact on an animal, a publication is in an open format.

(¬G → ¬A1).natural: If there is no conservation impact on an animal, then it is not the case that a platform uses a research database for a researcher.

(¬G → ¬A20).natural: Whenever there is no conservation impact on an animal, it is not the case that a publication is in a proprietary format.

A24.natural: The data in a publication is curated.

G.natural: There is a conservation impact on an animal.

¬A10.natural: It is not the case that the data in a publication is verified.

¬A2.natural: A technology does not collect field data on an animal.

¬A22.natural: It is not the case that a publication is in an incompatible format.

¬A25.natural: The analysis in a publication is not flawed.

¬A29.natural: It is not the case that a hypothesis in a publication is rejected.

¬A30.natural: A hypothesis in a publication is not supported.

¬A43.natural: A project does not miss a milestone.

¬A9.natural: A publication does not have missing data.
